page.title: 11THE LOCAL PRESS
page.content: Very much against the trend elsewhere, Renfrew is well supplied by local news papers. As well as the daily published Paisley Express which includes stories concerning Renfrew, there is the Renfrew and Erskine Gazette which is produced weekly on Thursdays. This replaced the Renfrew Press in 1983 which was closed after being taken over. The Gazette deals with items of local news and local human interest such as the proposed sports complex at the Deanpark Hotel, sports events and photographs of local weddings. It also contains advertisements on local house sales, jobs and items for sale as well as commercial advertising. Since 1984 a free newspaper has been delivered by local children for pocket money to households in Renfrew. It is sponsored by local commercial adverts and fees from classified ads.
